response.content:
```json
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8‑inch round cake pans. In a large bowl whisk together 1½ cups flour, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 1½ tsp baking soda, ½ tsp baking powder, and ½ tsp salt. Set aside.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl, beat 1 cup sugar, ½ cup butter, and 2 eggs until light and fluffy. Add 1 tsp vanilla extract and mix well. Gradually pour in 1 cup buttermilk, stirring until smooth. Combine wet mixture with dry ingredients, folding gently to avoid lumps.",
  "step3": "Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Tap pans lightly on the counter to release air bubbles. Place in the oven and bake for 25–30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool in pans 10 minutes.",
  "step4": "While cakes cool, prepare frosting: beat ½ cup softened butter until creamy. Gradually add 2 cups powdered sugar, ¼ cup cocoa powder, 2 tbsp milk, and 1 tsp vanilla. Beat until smooth and spreadable. If frosting is too thick, add a splash more milk.",
  "step5": "Once cakes are completely cooled, level tops with a knife if needed. Place one cake layer on a serving plate, spread a generous layer of frosting. Top with the second layer, then apply a thin crumb coat of frosting all around. Chill for 15 minutes to set the crumb coat.",
  "step6": "Finish with a final thick layer of frosting, smoothing with a spatula. Decorate with chocolate shavings or sprinkles if desired. Slice, serve, and enjoy a moist, rich chocolate cake perfect for eight guests."
}
```
